user.biography:
❤️Head brewer at @jaggedmountaincb  
🏔 Texan living in Denver
🍺 Advocate for diversity in beer 
✈️ Traveling brewer/speaker

node.text: Drinking a hoppy table beer from @bigalicebrewing and spicy pickle beer from @martinhousebrewing

node.text:
So you want to be a beer influencer, eh? Use these simple steps and take the world by storm! 
.
Had a great time making this video with my buds over at @rotatingtapcomedy @fakekoreydavid @slumdogchillionaire

node.title: Crash course to beer influencing with @rotatingtapcomedy

node.text:
Who likes micheladas as much as I do?! I am super pumped to be travelling to Mexico City in October and I am already prepping so when @brewhouse.legends sent me a box of their delicious snack mix I fell in love with the Michelada flavor. I've never had a more unique snack mix with ingredients like hot Cajun sticks, praline pepitas, rice crackers, corn nuts and peanuts mixed with tangy tomato flavor. One of their pairing recommendations is of course a craft Michelada! So I decided to show you guys how I make my  own. Here's the stuff you will need-
Craft Mexican Lager
Clamato
Worcestershire Sauce
Soy Sauce or Maggi
Tajin Seasoning
Lime Wedges
Tapatio Hot sauce
@brewhouse.legends Michelada snack mix
Be sure to check out there other great flavors ( I really Liked the "hops and pepper" too!) What do you guys think about these How To videos? I am thinking of doing some on brewing, with segments on mash in, boil, knockout, and the occasional mixed drink ;) Comment below with what how-to video you would want to see. Cheers!

#michelada #redbeer #craftbeer #iloveberr #beercoxktail #bloody #mexicanveer #craftbeerme # #craftbeerlife #drinklocal #howto #beerbabe #beerbeauty #cheers #prost #bier #mexicanlager

node.title: How to make a michelada inspired by @brewhouse.legends Sanckmix

clips_music_attribution_info.should_mute_audio_reason: Instagram music isn't available in your region.

node.accessibility_caption: Photo by Alyssa in Coors Field. May be an image of 1 person and outdoors.

node.text:
⚾️ PLAY BALL! ⚾️
Part of being a head brewer is predicting your crowd- when I first started at @jaggedmountaincb the previous head brewer loved making high ABV, barrel aged, and strong beers. While all of these beers were delicious I really didn’t think it fit for the crowd that frequented us. The taproom is just a few blocks from Coors Field, and we rely pretty heavily on the baseball crowd. The first year here I started making a huge pivot to more drinkable beers- lower ABV, lots of clean, refreshing lagers. Fruited sours that are balanced and not pucker inducing, and the ever loved string of hazy IPAs. I pride myself on making beers for everyone. It’s not always about what you like to drink as a brewer. It’s still a business after all!

It’s been a great feeling to be in the mix with this years All Star baseball game and seeing people from around the world visit the taproom and drink the beers I made 🥰 if you’re in town, be sure to stop by and have a beer shot with me at the bar 🍻

node.accessibility_caption: Photo by Alyssa in Jagged Mountain Craft Brewery. May be an image of 1 person, standing and indoor.

node.text:
🧳 TEXAS SUITCASE IPA RECIPE 
One beer that I have been most proud of is this year is this classic west coast IPA that has become our new flagship IPA at @jaggedmountaincb 🎉 I wanted to make something that was easy to drink with a simple grain bill, juicy but just bitter enough, crystal clear with amazing head retention…basically my ideal IPA! I love this beer so much- so I’d love to share the details with you ♥️
Stats- 5.5% ABV, 50 IBU 
Hops- Cascade, chinook for bittering at first wort hop and 30min. 
Strata, Azacca at 15min, whirlpool, and dry hop. 
Grains- 80% 2-row, 8% dextrine, 5% flaked rye, and 3% honey malt
YEAST- @inland_island Colorado IPA (INIS 003) 
This beer was fermented for one week at 67° then bumped up to 70° for diacetyl rest. Crashed and Biofined, carbed to around 2.5 vol. 

If you have more questions on this beer drop them below 👇🏼 and I’ll do my best to answer!

node.accessibility_caption: Photo by Alyssa in Rhino Art District. May be an image of 1 person and drink.

node.text:
“The world breaks everyone, and afterward, some are strong at the broken places”
Feeling positive, strong, and….truly happy for the first time in a while. New fresh downtown apartment, and a good outlook on the future while still working and concentrating on myself has really paid off. I’m grateful for so many things and people in my life who help me through hard times. Now to celebrate with a beer with my name on it from @baycannonbeer 🍻

Happy Monday everyone! Let’s crush this week!

node.accessibility_caption: Photo by Alyssa in Downtown Denver. May be an image of 1 person and standing.

node.text:
WE CAN DO BETTER 
It’s been a hard week as a female identifying person in the craft beer industry. If you haven’t read all of the accounts of sexual harassment, racism, discrimination, and wildly inappropriate behavior recounted by hundreds of women in the form of mostly anonymous DMs sent to a fellow female craft brewer @ratmagnet - you definitely fucking should. 
I would like to say that I’m surprised. But I’m really not. After being in this industry for over 6 years now, I have not only heard countless stories first hand from women in every facet of the brewing world, but experienced these kinds of things myself....so much so I’ve almost gotten numb to it. I can’t tell you how many times I’ve gotten asked in interviews and conversations “What is it like being a female brewer in the craft beer industry?” And the honest answer is - it fucking sucks sometimes. It’s always an uphill battle to prove my worth, to avoiding drunk men at beer festivals, to hear women’s stories and the fear we all have on saying something. The dark underbelly of this industry is infested with sexual assault and harassment. 
But a few things I do know about all of us girls in this male dominated industry is that we are resilient. We are strong. And we are ready to fight. We are ready to fight for a place that we can feel comfortable and confident, for a workplace free of harassment and sexual assault, for resources to go to when something like this happens so action can be taken instead of it being swept under the rug. I believe in us. 
These stories are damn hard to hear, but we’ve rocked the boat. We’re making waves that will put forth change in this industry that we all love. I encourage everyone to take time to form groups and talk through what we can do to change this. I encourage breweries to have a no tolerance policy for offenders. Take steps to making this a better, safer workplace- for EVERYONE.

node.accessibility_caption: Photo by Alyssa in Denver, Colorado. May be a closeup of 2 people.

node.text:
Hi. I’m 31 today. 
This past year has been a goddamn rollercoaster. Covid gave me time to reflect on who I am as a person and who I want to be. Working on yourself has never come naturally or easy for me- like I’ve said in the past I am a huge people pleaser. Stepping away from outside expectations of what I should do with my life and trying to live as my most authentic self has been the most challenging, but by far the most rewarding part of my year. 
Putting yourself first doesn’t come without consequences. Sometimes you drift away from previously great friends and sometimes, like with me, a marriage. Divorce is something I definitely didn’t have planned this year at 31....but here I am. 
I’ve learned to be selfish with my time this year and to only allow people who I want to be in my inner circle, in. I’ve learned that it really isn’t anyones business, and I will talk about things when I feel like I want to, if ever. To some it probably looks like I’ve become withdrawn and antisocial, but honestly I find freedom in privacy. Just know it’s been a rough few months, but I am more capable and stronger than ever because of it. 
I’m constantly in the process of learning to love myself. Always trying to improve and live a life I can truly enjoy. Because we only have one life to live after all....
All this to say- love yourself, pursue your passions, form a close circle of support, and live your life in a way you find the most fulfilling. Onwards and upwards for me this year, and hopefully you too 🍻 glad I survived some dark times this year to see the light on the other side, and many, many beers to go.

node.accessibility_caption: Photo by Alyssa in Denver, Colorado with @vailcraftbeerclassic. May be an image of one or more people and brick wall.

node.text:
Does anyone else miss beer festivals like I do? In normal, pre-COVID life spring and summer is loaded with weekly beer festivals. I miss the tiny taster glasses, the crowds of people lining up for my beer excited to ask questions, pretzel necklaces, and just the overall energy that being with friends sharing some beer brings. That's why I am SO EXCITED to be attending one of my first beer festivals in over a year! Vail Craft Beer Classic will be held in beautiful Vail, Colorado June 25 & 26th. The Vail Craft Beer Classic has tickets on sale now. They're capping the event at 250 people for each session, so everyone is a VIP and the first festival back will be a safe one. I can't wait to take a long weekend for the Beer Classic. There's something about the mountains and the sunshine that makes beer taste better. Use the code SOUTHERN for 10% off tickets.
@vailcraftbeerclassic

node.accessibility_caption: Photo by Alyssa in 420 High. May be an image of 1 person and drink.

node.text:
👽 Happy 4/20 👽

Did you know hops and weed are extremely similar? Cannabis and Humulus Lupulus (hops) have extremely similar organoleptic properties involving taste and smell- this is because of the terpene or terpenoid compounds found in both plants. Flavors like pine, citrus, floral, and fruit can be found in both hops and cannabis due to specific terpenes. It’s believed that different terpenes in cannabis can affect your mood and sense of relief- for example the compound lemonene is known to provide an uplifting high- this compound is also found in many varieties of hops known to give an intense citrus flavor and aroma. 

I always like to pair delicious IPAs with my cannabis - today I’m drinking @breweryommegang Neon Rainbows - a New England IPA with 5 different varieties of hops paired with a pink Panda Puffs Kaiser Roll @kaiserrollz303 😋

node.accessibility_caption: Photo by Alyssa in Sunken Gardens Park with @petainerglobal. May be an image of 1 person and outdoors.

node.text:
Spring is here in Denver! As most of you know by now I am a big lover of warmer weather and being outdoors and one of my favorite local activities to do is to walk over to a local park and enjoy the sun with a delicious beer. I was lucky enough to be working with my friends over at @petainerglobal testing out these awesome 10L mini kegs - I love this option because they are super easy to fill since they come fully sanitized, they are extremely lightweight (I actually carried this one in my backpack!) and environmentally friendly being 100% recyclable after use. I filled this little guy up with some of our new Maibock, a spring lager, which went down so well in the warm sun and toasting to a summer full of new adventures!
What are you most excited to do this summer?

#ad #petainer #petainerkegs #goanywhere #onewaykegs #minikeg #sustainable #recyclable #craftbeer #getoutdoors #goanywhere #craftbeerlife #craftbeerlover #craftbeergirl #craftbeernerd #probrewer #homebrew #brewer #girlsthatbrew #brewerylife #keg #kegerator #beer #craftbeerstagram #beerselfie #beerme #parkhangs

node.text:
So you want to be a beer influencer, eh? Use these simple steps and take the world by storm! 
.
Had a great time making this video with my buds over at @rotatingtapcomedy @fakekoreydavid @slumdogchillionaire

node.accessibility_caption: Photo by Alyssa in Jagged Mountain Craft Brewery with @huckleberryroasters, and @goldspotbrewing. May be an image of 1 person and indoor.

node.text:
☕️ COFFEE & BEER ☕️
Over the years of brewing, I’ve made a LOT of coffee beers. There’s many ways to introduce coffee into beer before packing and I’ve tried many of them -cold brew, adding ground beans, tincture, or my personal favorite, steeping whole beans in finished beer. 
I love supporting local companies when I can and coffee is something that I always try to get locally. Here at @jaggedmountaincb we have a blonde stout with coffee and cocoa nibs where we rotate the roasts so every time I make a new batch it really showcases the different coffees used. For this particular batch I am using @huckleberryroasters for a Caramel Macchiato Blonde stout in collaboration with @goldspotbrewing going into cans tomorrow!
For this particular batch I did about 4lbs of coffee beans per barrel of beer in mesh sacks in the brite tank, then racked finished beer on top. I let this sit for about two days (or depending on how it’s tasting) then carbonate and package! This method has given us the best, well rounded coffee flavor while also being shelf stable for a long period of time. This beer - “Bunny Slope” is a fan favorite 🤩 
What’s your favorite coffee beer?

node.accessibility_caption: Photo by Alyssa on February 18, 2021. May be an image of 1 person and indoor.

node.text:
🗣EMPOWERED WOMEN EMPOWER WOMEN🗣
For many years now after gathering a large following on this platform I’ve struggled to follow any “brand” or direction. I’ve posted a few times about identity through social media and how it really skews reality. When I took the head brewer job at @jaggedmountaincb I told myself I was going to do nothing but professional, industry related posts and gear it more towards a supporting role in my career. 
But one message that has always stayed the same - authenticity. I try my best to always stay real with you guys. Whether that’s behind the scenes brewing, my struggles in my own life, my successes and failures...I show all of it. 
When I posted my sexy valentines photo I was once again surprised on backlash over this. As someone who tries to be a strong voice as a woman in a male dominated field feeling sexy and comfortable with your body has been one of the most empowering things for me. I am a woman, and I am all of these things wrapped into one package - I am outspoken but shy, a hard worker but lover of fun, a deep thinker with anxiety, sexy but conservative, strong but sometimes weak....
All of this to say, I am who I am, and no one is going to change me. I’ll keep endlessly forging my path, doing my own thing even if that doesn’t fit into my “brand” or other people’s expectations of me. You only have one life...and I plan to live it however the fuck I want 🍺
